availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lucas W. Trafton (Henderson County, Kentucky, county judge)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, county judge. Indiana native. Son of William Trafton and America Butler Trafton. Married Helen Gibbs Trafton in Henderson County, Kentucky on November 25, 1865. Attended Wabash College c.1853 in Crawfordsville, Indiana. County Judge in Henderson County, Kentucky in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Henderson County in 1860. Mustered in as private in the Tenth Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) on August 23, 1862. Promoted to quartermaster of the Tenth Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) on November 4, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States_ (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 28.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, p. 37.

Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 2 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 64.

Edmund L. Starling, History of Henderson County, Kentucky (Henderson, Kentucky, 1887), 751-752 (accessed vis ancestry.com).
